# Registration at the Municipality Office – Welcome Point

URL: https://wtp.agh.edu.pl/registration-in-municipality-district-office/
Crawled: 2025-03-19 21:23:46

Welcome Point
 > 
Legal arrangements
 > 
Registration at the Municipality Office

Registration at the Municipality Office

What is a municipality/district office?

In addition to having a visa and other permits, it is 
mandatory 
for all the visitors, but also for Polish nationals to register their stay in a municipality of your city/town.

Required documents

a dedicated registration form
 → if you have a rental contract the registration form does not need to be signed by the owner / if you are staying in a hotel/dormitory, the form needs to be signed by the authorised person of the facility

a rental contract (of the apartment/room etc.) or hotel/dormitory reservation (if applies)

ID card/passport (for non-EU citizens – passport!)

for family members → documents confirming the relation (e.g. marriage certificate, birth certificate) – translated by a certified Polish translator

for third-country nationals (not EU citizens) -> a visa or residence permit

Time frames

You need to register if you are:

an EU citizen staying in Poland for more than 3 months – register within the first 30 days after your arrival

a non-EU citizen staying in Poland for more than 30 days – register within the first 4 days after your arrival

Where to register?

UMK Wydział Spraw Administracyjnych, al. Powstania Warszawskiego 10, 31-541 Kraków; 
Google Maps

UMK Wydział Spraw Administracyjnych, ul. os. Zgody 2, 31-949 Kraków; 
Google Maps

UMK, ul. Wielicka 28a, 30-552 Kraków; 
Google Maps

Punkt obsługi mieszkańców w Galerii Bronowice, ul. Stawowa 61, 31-346 Kraków (lokal nr 193); 
Google Maps

Fees
The registration is free of charge. Written confirmation costs 17 PLN.

More information about mandatory registration of stay
